documents.document: People gathering on the streets of New York to protest and Fox News is doing public affairs stories on whiskey making and celebrity artists.
@RogueNASA has over 721 THOUSAND followers- I still haven't broken 700. Without the thousand. You go, you rogues, you.
I need a creepiness meter to decide whether to watch a paranormal movie just before bed. (Insert creepy sound effect here.)
I've sent these lovelies to The Ivy Box in Queenstown - so excited to be joining their team! https://t.co/EB0pzWJaww
I'm nowhere near the airport, but every once in a while we get a low, loud... jet? I think it's an alien patrol unit, of the UFO kind.
If you want to learn salsa, now's your moment. All the WGTN dance teachers are coming back. Try Cuban Fusion: https://t.co/LKruJg1dsJ
For a master class in how to blog, plus a nice inside look at how a graphics pro makes magic, check this out: https://t.co/Rs4eeOo7sq
Never mind who's President; all parties will be considered equally tasty: https://t.co/cjj1JcHQsk
Must make a point of going to about 3 @CarlosNavae gigs in a row. I quite like it when his voice is on 'repeat' in the back of my brain.
Apparently the back of my brain is trapped in the 80s.
And also, I have FINALLY replaced the really bad 80s song playing on repeat in my head. With... a GOOD 80s song.
Way more women than men at Southern Cross tonight, which made it a lovely chance to catch up with friends.
WGTN: Southern Cross White Christmas (salsa) dance party from 6 pm tonight. Be there or be square.
This explains everything: https://t.co/mLyXUogTgA
Overheard on the bus: "She asked what I was doing and I said, 'Uh-failing at life?'" Ouch.
A little something in green. https://t.co/TpH1yhylPV
Now till the end of 2016, I think we should all emphasise posts which include the word 'unicorn.' This will help us.
Worth considering as an end-of-year resolution: if we only read or repost articles that use the word 'unicorn',... https://t.co/U5PG9SmLJT
Friday 9 Dec from 9 p.m. @CarlosNavae is playing at Wellington's Adulis restaurant. Dunno if there's room in there to dance, but I'm going.
Wellington's Havana Bar, Sat 3 December there's a Cumbia event. Probably ridiculously fun for salseros & more normal people, also. Might go.
Okay, confession: I really like the newish Supergirl series. All those perky, upbeat, fashionably dressed aliens. Plus random kick-fighting.
If I were an alien race wanting to conquer humans I would introduce techno music & go away for a generation. Job done.
I had techno music on the other day. It's like: tweet-tweet-tweet, thump-thump-thump (repeat) until you think your head is going to explode.
Awesome article by satirical author of NZ's The Civilian: https://t.co/9GWJ3cnULi
Wow. We'd better hope this is hay fever. Otherwise, I'm the vector for a whole new form of plague.
The fabulous thing about living at tree height is you get lovely bird sound effects pretty much all the time. It's nice.
Something gorgeous for Sunday afternoon. I hope your weekend included good company, lovely weather, and minimal... https://t.co/xB2UqYUpY9
Finally reading Aaronovitch's The Hanging Tree and it is just so worth it. A writer's writer, doing dark fantasy. Can't ask for more.
The part where I already knew these things: I worry about myself. https://t.co/c5H1tlGAqi
@CarlosNavae (w Son Clave) was on fine form @ Southern Cross tonight. Mad salsering ensued. Nice start to the weekend.
@CarlosNavae is playing Latin fusion @ Wellington's Southern Cross Friday from 9:30 pm. Always a good Friday night option. (No cover.)
Except of course now I have blue -went out in the rain and got some! So, really, some less-dark form of gorgeous-gorgeous is probably next.
So now I'm worried I need to make it a whole series and name it: 'ran out of blue' ...
And you know how people love to psychoanalyse artists and say, 'yes, this was her dark phase?' Well you can see that coming, can't you?
Okay, now let's talk about art. This weekend I ran out of blue, & did some gorgeous-gorgeous work ... that just kept getting darker.
Wellington has salsa dancing every night of the week. But most of it starts late, & if I have to get up early... Yep. That's me sleeping.
Cuba Fusion always does a nice job of their 2nd Sunday salsa @ S Cross, & I'm such a lightweight, I love that it's EARLY evening fun!
Turning into a really nice weekend. Braved the rain for a couple of hours of (warming!) Friday night salsa/rueda... https://t.co/Vr2lLcgNvf
Wellington Sunday from 6 it's the 10th anniversary Cuban Fusion FREE lesson-music-salsa dancing fun @ Southern Cross. Always oarsome.
Wellington salsa rueda practica tonight @ Tarrant Studios (Cuba St.), 7:30-9:00, int/adv. Our female leads rock, but we could use men.
This morning at the gym I was looking at this guy's leg, thinking the art in his tattoo was quite good. He thought I liked his leg. Oops.
From FB Word Porn: 'Life is way too short to leave the key to your happiness in someone else's pocket.' Nice.
Got sidetracked into finishing V Gischeer's 'Ink Mage' before starting Aaronovitch's 'The Hanging Tree'...NO SPOILERS before I get there!
I got you a link and everything. What would you expect from a Dr Who writer? He had to be good: https://t.co/RqaMMYEPs6
Don't anybody try to talk to me, I have Important Reading Things To Do!
Major news flash: Ben Aaronovitch's The Hanging Tree was delivered to my Kindle today. Yuuusss!
It's a lot of things. Which, apparently is my happy place. On that note, we have a UFO sighting near Lake Taupo: https://t.co/sfJOiiOIYb
Although I'll also say that there are some very nice new artworks starting to materialise on my SharonKilzer Artist/Author FB page.
And THEN ... I decided I'd better pause. I had two paintings going to an art show and I still have an actual job and ... yeah.
The working part is especially nice. Very, very awesome to make a web site and have it actually work. https://t.co/0pwftFn8RZ
And of course, that was hard. And it took a long time. But now the web site is beautiful. And it works. https://t.co/0pwftFn8RZ
And then - oh, wait - the app needed a web site. OF COURSE it did! Silly me. So, you know, I made one of those. https://t.co/0pwftFn8RZ
And then I survived the process of uploading the app to iTunes. Which, apparently, is a career field in itself. https://t.co/VqBy6jxBSn
I'm actually pretty proud of the app. It works. That's a pretty big accomplishment, all by itself. https://t.co/VqBy6jxBSn
Because, you know, a lot of sane people DON'T take up app writing, because, like, it might be hard. https://t.co/VqBy6jxBSn
So I taught myself how to write an app. It was hard. And it took a really long time. This surprised me. https://t.co/VqBy6jxBSn
AUT's Original Art Sale is on this weekend! Don't forget to stop by to have a look at all the beautiful things!... https://t.co/TPE0emp7Sv
I posted 2 photos on Facebook in the album "AUT's Original Art Sale paintings" https://t.co/8M23oI41Vq
Two paintings going into AUT's Original Art Sale (opening night 13 October), cover photo shows one - both are for... https://t.co/BpOVgjbNlD
Okay, someone had to like Terra Nova, & apparently it was me. Repainted nerf blasters & bad dinos-yes! https://t.co/Sy9Eur48S3
Russian alien corpses & a reference to tin-foil hats: this article is fabulous! http://t.co/iVDIltPmYA
Except this one is a grown man acting like a cat. In a fabulous and creepy way: https://t.co/3d6XwW4Zr2
Creepy. And fabulous. Much like the grown man with barrettes in his hair acting like the two-year old girl. https://t.co/3d6XwW4Zr2
Best alien-related line ever: 'we're rare, we're first or ...' http://t.co/Qie0UuZrDf
So now we know what a #gorgosaurus is. Because, clearly, this is important.
Succeeded in roasting chestnuts, then ate...two. What a weird food. If you only ate chestnuts, you'd be very thin. http://t.co/PjrzvJ5epH
Artificial Intelligence, turned loose on YouTube, taught itself to recognise untagged human faces and ... cats. http://t.co/MiJCVpXSQd
I can't believe anyone would try to travel in a plane's wheel well, but apparently it happens. And is deadly. Wow. http://t.co/Fc3ilDNETu
Yep. That whole #distractinglysexy scientist-chick moment just made my week. Thank you, ladies.
Oh-my-GOD have you seen the women scientists who've put up #distractinglysexy Tweets?!?!?! Gorgeousness!
See. I knew we needed more blue hair in the world: http://t.co/6bSvXYIhIi
Fabulous. And a nice summary of why life in New Zealand is NOT the same as in the U.S. http://t.co/4k3qDsi9JP
I really wish they'd stop putting tags in clothing. That is all.
The thing about Wellington (New Zealand) is we spend a lot of time having Autumn. All year round. But, tell you what: we're in Winter now.
Hoverboard! Yes!!! http://t.co/PYArLABtWd
Nice article, pointing out the obvious, yet again: when in doubt, be nice. http://t.co/5MFnjAVu6S
You know it's that the issue isn't really one of adjusting, anyway. What they really need to do is come up with something genuinely new.
Considering the people who invented TV pretty much invented advertising as we know it, I find it fascinating that now they can't adjust.
Because at 35, after 20+ years of tech-savvy, free surfing they'll be willing to pay for preset, commercial-laden, really boring TV content?
So if people learn to sidestep TV by the age of 12, does anyone really believe they'll just wake up and change?
(And I've personally spent enough on mascara in my lifetime to have paid for a car. Although then I'd have been driving a car mascara-less.)
You know they say women pick a mascara brand by age 17 & stay with it for life?
And are young people even watching TV? Or are they completely sidestepping their parents' process & watching each other's YouTube videos?
I keep thinking TV is ready for something genuinely new, anyway. So far it's just all repackaging.
Telecom has offered me some kind of free TV service. Which would be great if I had a TV. But if I did, I'd probly have service, too. Silly.
When I go, a candlelit vigil will be unnecessary. As will, hopefully, a cow onesie. http://t.co/ncHHKl32SE
Of course, there is more to life than connectivity. Or the risk of sudden, plate-caused, fiery death: http://t.co/mvkfB5vren
Bok choy. That is all. (And all anyone needs, really.)
Tell you what: http://t.co/GmGv3VBRPT
Loving the volcanoes-tsunamis-quakes link: http://t.co/GlMKB6eOe5
This week's Cosmic Thought: if you're dancing, it's probably a good indication you're not dead yet. https://t.co/vOg2zFoaYE
Once again, not comforted: http://t.co/TgGY0Kg9M2
This would be even more relevant of he'd discussed the mass displacements roboticisation will cause: http://t.co/ZraDEowy9B
Whales and elephants won't be far behind: http://t.co/Y3r81O9ZLd
I've the Being A Grownup Is Hard place. This article cheered me immensely: http://t.co/wtsHKEYF5m
Still trying to give away the Strawberry Babies. Apparently strawberries do this. How did I not know?
FB keeps asking me to friend my workmates. Cuz what? I don't know their names and couldn't do this on my own if I wanted?
Haven't decided if this is really cool or a bit oppressive: catch an octopus & train it to help with selfies...http://t.co/iR3bO3CEg2
They worked so hard at this & did an amazing job. It deserves international good press: http://t.co/jz0D7tW2gk
And of course zucchini is a very nice weed, but when you start leaving anonymous piles of head-sized squashes everywhere you go... Yeah.
